metadata.title: CVE-2014-7230 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The processutils.execute function in OpenStack oslo-incubator, Cinder,Nova, and Trove before 2013.2.4 and 2014.1 before 2014.1.3 allows localusers to obtain passwords from commands that cause a ProcessExecutionErrorby reading the log.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7230` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cinder-api - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
cinder-backup - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
cinder-common - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
cinder-scheduler - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
cinder-volume - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
python-cinder - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-libvirt - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-vmware - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-console - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-consoleauth - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-network - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-placement-api - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-serialproxy - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
python-nova - 1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cinder package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1').
trove: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nova package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.2~rc2-0ubuntu1').
